title: Season 6 Sucked Dicks for Melee
body:
I'm not lying when I say this past season sucked donkey dicks. 

So many changes happened during this season that ruined the balance between Melee and Ranged.
Forget even attempting to fight a ranged champion as a melee nowadays, you're not allowed to farm, you're not allowed to try and all in because you get chunked well before that, you're not even allowed to hide under your turret. It's just a constant barrage of poke and getting chunked - go back home, either tp or walk back to lane, get chunked again but you have no tp now so you sit under turret and then get all in'd. 

Ranged champions across the board got buffed in season 6. Marksmen and Mage update really shifted the balance of early game power towards ranged. Before these changes, ADC's had significantly weaker stats compared to melees as a means of a clutch for their amazing late game potential with their ease of kiting, poking and dps. Mages on the otherhand, benefited extremely well with keystones and then on top of that, were given some pretty good itemisation options (protobelt specifically). Whilst all this was going on, Melees were left shafted. Only the truly 'op' or abusive champions were allowed to be good and even then, they fell out of favour quickly as ranged became prominent picks up to keep them at bay. 

Ranged champions have an inherent advantage over melee champions, but there just isn't adequate optimisation in either the keystone or item department that allows melee champions to alleviate this burden.

What item do I bring when I have to lane against a quinn or jayce? Cloth 5? It really feels like I end up at Cloth 0 at 3 mins. Doran's shield? It doesn't even feel like I even came to lane with anything. What about when they are ap? There's nothing that helps me against the AP match up. It's just a feelsbad scenario across the board. Mid to Late game, sure if you're tank and you went full ARMOR then yes, maybe the adc light smacks aren't hurting you thoroughly but for anyone else it really is a matter of kill or be killed. There really isn't any good options for melees to idk, close the gap or take less damage for a brief second or something to allow them to do their job and kill the ranged champs before getting totally poked out.

Then we come to the keystone section and the one thing i can say confidently is every damage option just works better on a ranged champion. There is no contest to this. Sure maybe that cheesy AD Xin top might hurt hard if he gets close and QQQ you down but at least you can trade back and are allowed to walk up and down your lane without taking obscene amounts of damage for free. Ranged champions on the other hand can land 3 auto's and proc thunderlord's or just sit back and stack fervor on you. You proceed to attempt to take your 3rd melee creep and get done in by another TD proc or get AA'd to death by ferver users. You now have two options (barring jungle gank) - you sit back and cry as you lose a shit load of gold or you go back, recuperate your masochist energy to come back into lane as a lvl 1 or 2 vs a lvl 4 and proceed to have the same thing happen only worse. gg.

NONE OF THESE DAMAGE MASTERIES MAKES IT ANY EASIER FOR MELEE CHAMPIONS TO GO UP AGAINST RANGED CHAMPIONS BUT GOING DEFENSIVE DOESN'T SAVE YOU EITHER. 

Legit, where are masteries to make your minions bash up the enemy aggressor for picking on you or the masteries that allow you to absorb a bit more damage periodically or even the mastery that allows you to not get fucked in the ass by creep block when you're fleeing for your life for arrogantly thinking you could sneak off 1 cs. There's really nothing that is a good standard pick or situational keystone that allows melees to alleviate ranged bullshit.

May melee rest in pepperonis.
 
P.S: FK REDSMITE RANGED JUNGLERS, THINKING THEY CAN GO MELEE FORM ON YO ASS CAUSE OF THAT DAMAGE REDUCTION AND DAMAGE, THE HELL.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tl;dr - Melee have no good masteries or items to alleviate burden of range disadvantage and ranged champions can abuse basically everything. pls gib proper funeral for melee.

I partially agree. While Darius is going to have _real fun_ against top lane Vel'koz (and let's not even mention Quinn) Wukong would likely **destroy** that beholder. It's the difference between _mobile_ and **immobile**.

Currently, the more mobile the champion, the higher the winrate (this is in most cases, obviously this doesn't apply to all champions in League). Now I have **_no idea_** how this is going to be balanced because I've never ran a MOBA or any other online game and I doubt you have either. So I guess the best thing we can do is to be patient and continue to ban and counterpick until the issue is resolved.

Mobility, power spikes, damage all of these calculations is what melee players HAVE to do in order to win. The match ups is significantly harder for the wukong than the quinn/graves or whatnot. As long as they know their boundaries and proceed to abuse range and keystone advantage, you'll end up finding it hard to make a come back and slowly get zoned outta lane.

This is only true if you don't engage at a good time. I did see a matchup of Wukong against Ryze top and Wukong lost because he never pulled a solid engage. He just sat back and got poked/harassed until he was low enough for _Ryze_ to engage up-close and kill him.

Perhaps in the very early levels when minion-aggro is a threat, engaging _might_ not be a good idea.

But slowy tanks and juggernauts are really likely to benefit from Courage of the Colossus since they'll finally have an edge to counter ranged top laners with. Grasp of the Undying will be useful for melee vs. melee matchups and Courage of the Colossus will reward the colossus's courage to engage.

I can't remember what season it was, but I enjoyed the meta where nearly everything was viable and we saw a lot of variation in picks and bans. The problem with this season that I tried to outline is the heavy shift in focus on damage without proper gating which brings to light the age old issue of ranged vs melee. This season, ranged champions have had a massive increase in their itemisation, keystone and even kit - for melee's only the recent juggernauts (whom have been gutted) and reworked champs on the lines of pseudo-melee (gankplank and fiora) are able to keep up with the meta. 
Tanks can't seem to find a place to join because their team gets obliterated too quickly (rumble, kennen, jayce, ryze - all good for making fights end quickly) and bruisers struggle in lane and then struggle afterwards to make a difference anyways.

Obviously there are a few exceptions who even when they get shit on can still be effective (poppy) but I don't think it's a healthy thing to have the only available melee chars as hyper scaling tanks.
